intro: Pseudoernestia glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular pseudoernestia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves that are often covered in small, glandular dots, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it blooms from spring to early summer. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is considered somewhat rare in the wild.
